title: Phone Number
description: Information that allows the phone calling of a person. Typically an alphanumeric number, 1-222-333 4444 in North America, but can have a wide range of formats.

xdm:primary.title: Primary
xdm:primary.description:
Primary phone number indicator.

Unlike for Address or EmailAddress, there can be multiple primary phone numbers; one per communication channel.
The communication channel is defined by the type:

* `textMessaging`: type = `mobile`
* `phone`: type = `home` | `work` | `unknown`
* `fax`: type = `fax`

xdm:number.title: Number
xdm:number.description: The phone number. Note the phone number is a string and may include meaningful characters such as brackets (), hyphens - or characters to indicate sub dialing identifiers like extensions x. E.g 1-353(0)18391111 or +613 9403600x1234.

xdm:extension.title: Extension
xdm:extension.description: The internal dialing number used to call from a private exchange, operator or switchboard.

xdm:status.title: Status
xdm:status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the phone number.

xdm:statusReason.title: Status Reason
xdm:statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

xdm:validity.title: Validity
xdm:validity.description: A level of technical correctness of the phone number.
